  "article_text": [
    "optimal quantization is a fundamental problem in signal processing , data compression and information theory .",
    "we refer to @xcite for surveys on the subject and comprehensive lists of references to the literature , see also @xcite . for mathematical treatment of quantization one",
    "is referred to graf - luschgy s book ( see @xcite ) . for most recent work about quantization for uniform distribution",
    "interested readers can also see @xcite .",
    "let @xmath4 denote the @xmath5-dimensional euclidean space , @xmath6 denote the euclidean norm on @xmath4 for any @xmath7 , and @xmath8 .",
    "then , the @xmath2th _ quantization error _ for a borel probability measure @xmath0 on @xmath4 is defined by @xmath9 where the infimum is taken over all subsets @xmath10 of @xmath11 with card@xmath12 . if @xmath13 then there is some set @xmath10 for which the infimum is achieved ( see @xcite ) .",
    "such a set @xmath14 for which the infimum occurs and contains no more than @xmath2 points is called an optimal set of @xmath2-means , or optimal set of @xmath2-quantizers .",
    "the elements of an optimal set are called optimal points . the collection of all optimal sets of @xmath2-means for a probability measure @xmath0 is denoted by @xmath15 .",
    "if @xmath14 is a finite set , in general , the error @xmath16 is often referred to as the cost or distortion error for @xmath14 , and is denoted by @xmath17 .",
    "thus , @xmath18 .",
    "it is known that for a continuous probability measure an optimal set of @xmath2-means always has exactly @xmath2-elements ( see @xcite ) .",
    "the number @xmath19 if it exists , is called the quantization dimension of the probability measure @xmath0 .",
    "quantization dimension measures the speed at which the specified measure of the error tends to zero as @xmath2 approaches to infinity . given a finite subset @xmath20 , the voronoi region generated by @xmath21 is defined by @xmath22 i.e. , the voronoi region generated by @xmath21 is the set of all points @xmath23 in @xmath4 such that @xmath24 is a nearest point to @xmath23 in @xmath14 , and the set @xmath25 is called the voronoi diagram or voronoi tessellation of @xmath4 with respect to @xmath14 .",
    "a voronoi tessellation is called a centroidal voronoi tessellation ( cvt ) , if the generators of the tessellation are also the centroids of their own voronoi regions with respect to the probability measure @xmath0 .",
    "a borel measurable partition @xmath26 , where @xmath14 is an index set , of @xmath4 is called a voronoi partition of @xmath4 if @xmath27 for every @xmath21 .",
    "let us now state the following proposition ( see @xcite ) :    [ prop10 ] let @xmath10 be an optimal set of @xmath2-means and @xmath21 .",
    "then ,    @xmath28 @xmath29 , @xmath30 @xmath31 , @xmath32 @xmath33 , and @xmath34 @xmath0-almost surely the set @xmath25 forms a voronoi partition of @xmath4 .",
    "let @xmath10 be an optimal set of @xmath2-means and @xmath35 , then by proposition  [ prop10 ] , we have @xmath36 which implies that @xmath24 is the centroid of the voronoi region @xmath37 associated with the probability measure @xmath0 ( see also @xcite ) .",
    "let @xmath0 be a borel probability measure on @xmath38 given by @xmath39 , where @xmath40 and @xmath41 for all @xmath42 .",
    "then , @xmath0 has support the classical cantor set @xmath43 . for this probability measure graf and",
    "luschgy gave a closed formula to determine the optimal sets of @xmath2-means and the @xmath2th quantization error for all @xmath3 ; they also proved that the quantization dimension of this distribution exists and is equal to the hausdorff dimension @xmath44 of the cantor set , but the @xmath45-dimensional quantization coefficient does not exist ( see @xcite ) .",
    "let us now consider a set of three contractive similarity mappings @xmath46 on @xmath47 , such that @xmath48 , @xmath49 , and @xmath50 for all @xmath51 .",
    "let r be the limit set of these contractive mappings .",
    "we call it the r - triangle generated by the contractive mappings @xmath46",
    ". let @xmath52 .",
    "then , @xmath0 is a unique borel probability measure on @xmath47 with support the r - triangle generated by @xmath46 .",
    "we call it as r - measure . for this r - measure ,",
    "cmez and roychowdhury determined the optimal sets of @xmath2-means and the @xmath2th quantization error for all @xmath3 .",
    "in addition , they showed that the quantization dimension of the r - measure exists which is equal to one , and it coincides with the hausdorff dimension of the r - triangle , the hausdorff and packing dimensions of the r - measure , i.e. , all these dimensions are equal to one . moreover , it was shown that the @xmath53-dimensional quantization coefficient for @xmath54 of the r - measure does not exist ( see @xcite ) .    in this paper",
    ", we have considered a set of three contractive similarity mappings @xmath46 on @xmath47 , such that @xmath55 , @xmath56 , and @xmath57 for all @xmath51 .",
    "let r be the limit set of these contractive mappings .",
    "we call it as a nonhomogeneous r - triangle generated by the contractive mappings @xmath46 . the term ` nonhomogeneous '",
    "is used to mean that the basic triangles at each level in the construction of the r - triangle are not of equal shape .",
    "let @xmath58 .",
    "then , @xmath0 is a unique borel probability measure on @xmath47 with support the nonhomogeneous r - triangle generated by @xmath46 .",
    "we call it as r - measure or more specifically nonhomogeneous r - measure . for this r - measure , in theorem  [ th1 ] , we state and prove an induction formula to determine the optimal sets of @xmath2-means for all @xmath3 . once the optimal sets are known , the corresponding quantization errors can easily be obtained .",
    "we also give some figures to illustrate the locations of the optimal points ( see figure  [ fig1 ] , figure  [ fig2 ] and figure  [ fig3 ] ) .",
    "in addition , using the induction formula we obtain some results and observations about the optimal sets of @xmath2-means which are given in section  4 ; a tree diagram of the optimal sets of @xmath2-means for a certain range of @xmath2 is also given ( see figure  [ fig4 ] ) .",
    "in this section , we give the basic definitions and lemmas that will be instrumental in our analysis . by a _ string _ or a _ word _",
    "@xmath59 over an alphabet @xmath60 , we mean a finite sequence @xmath61 of symbols from the alphabet , where @xmath62 , and @xmath63 is called the length of the word @xmath59 . a word of length zero is called the _",
    "empty word _ , and is denoted by @xmath64 . by @xmath65",
    "we denote the set of all words over the alphabet @xmath66 of some finite length @xmath63 including the empty word @xmath64 .",
    "by @xmath67 , we denote the length of a word @xmath68 .",
    "for any two words @xmath61 and @xmath69 in @xmath65 , by @xmath70 we mean the word obtained from the concatenation of @xmath59 and @xmath71 .",

    "the set @xmath93 is the r - triangle and equals the support of the probability measure @xmath0 . for @xmath94 ,",

    "notice that with respect to the median passing through the vertex @xmath154 , the r - triangle has the maximum symmetry , i.e. , with respect to the line @xmath155 the r - triangle is geometrically symmetric .",
    "also , observe that , if the two basic rectangles of similar geometrical shape lie in the opposite sides of the line @xmath155 , and are equidistant from the line @xmath155 , then they have the same probability ( see figure  [ fig1 ] , figure  [ fig2 ] or figure  [ fig3 ] ) ; hence , they are symmetric with respect to the probability distribution @xmath0 as well .    in the next section ,",

    "[ fig3 ]     to @xmath342.,width=7,height=8 ]    in the following theorem , we give the induction formula to determine the optimal sets of @xmath2-means for any @xmath3 .",
    "[ th1 ] for any @xmath3 , let @xmath343 be an optimal set of @xmath2-means , i.e. , @xmath344 . for @xmath279 , let @xmath315 and @xmath316 be defined by . set @xmath345 and @xmath346 .",

    ". notice that by lemma  [ lemma10 ] , we know @xmath354 .",
    "the theorem is true for @xmath355 . for any @xmath3 ,",
    "let us now assume that @xmath356 is an optimal set of @xmath2-means .",
    "let @xmath357 .",
    "let @xmath358 and @xmath359 be defined as in the hypothesis . if @xmath360 , i.e. , if @xmath361 , then by lemma  [ lemma11 ] , the error @xmath362 or @xmath363 obtained in this case is strictly greater than the corresponding error obtained in the case when @xmath364 .",
    "hence , for any @xmath347 , the set @xmath349 , where @xmath348 is an optimal set of @xmath350-means , and the number of such sets is @xmath351 thus , the proof of the theorem is complete .",
    "once an optimal set of @xmath2-means is known , by using , the corresponding quantization error can easily be calculated .",
    "using the induction formula given by theorem  [ th1 ] , we obtain some results and observations about the optimal sets of @xmath2-means , which are given in the following section .",
    "first , we explain about some notations that we are going to use in this section .",
    "recall that the optimal set of one - mean consists of the expected value of the random variable @xmath128 , and the corresponding quantization error is its variance .",

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> quantization of a probability distribution refers to the idea of estimating a given probability by a discrete probability supported by a finite set . in this paper , we have considered a borel probability measure @xmath0 on @xmath1 which has support the r - triangle generated by a set of three contractive similarity mappings on @xmath1 . for this probability measure , </S>",
    "<S> the optimal sets of @xmath2-means and the @xmath2th quantization error are determined for all @xmath3 . </S>"
  ]
}
